Home > Africa > Tanzania > Dar es Salaam > Dar es Salaam Restaurants > Marrybrown
Back to Marrybrown Marrybrown: Restaurant Reviews Haile Selasie Road , Dar es Salaam , Tanzania 0776075277 Ranked #50 of 87 restaurants in Dar es Salaam 21 Reviews 3 visitor photos Restaurant details Update restaurant details Write a Review 21 reviews from our community 23% Recommend Excellent 3 Very good 2 Average 8 Poor 7 Terrible 1 Rating summary Food Service Value Atmosphere 21 reviews sorted by Date Rating nightgardener Banbury, UK Contributor 16 reviews Reviews in 12 cities 7 helpful votes “OK fast food” Reviewed November 26, 2009 I went to the Marrybrown's in Mlimani City. It's a Malaysian chain, but looks exactly like any other fast food chain inside. I can only assume it's popular here because it's halal. It was very difficult ordering in English, despite there being huge menus to point to and my order being very simple (e.g."Menu 2 with Diet Coke, please"). The cashier struggled with giving the right change and when I asked for a receipt she seemed confused. My chicken burger was awful - random bits of disgusting chicken in breadcrumbs. Not quite what I expected! The burgers arrived first and the chips a lot later. My friend ordered a particular type of sauce and got another one. The chips were nice, though. I absolutely don't have high expectations of fast food chains, but this was just not very good!
Value Atmosphere
Service Food
Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 3 more reviews by nightgardener for Dar es Salaam Ask nightgardener about Marrybrown This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC. maximus2390 Malaysia Senior Reviewer 10 reviews Reviews in 7 cities 8 helpful votes “Fast Food at Dar-es-Salaam” Reviewed November 13, 2008 1 person found this review helpful Found this nice"fast food"restaurant in Dar-es-Salaam called Marrybrown. The place used to be a club house and renovated to be the biggest fast food joint with plenty of parking space.
It has a huge outdoor playground for children. Lots of families with children came to enjoy the facilities especially in the weekends.
The main menu is 2 types of fried chicken. An assortment of sandwiches and side orders. Interestingly it also serves various rice dishes appealing to the Asian market.
Attached to the restaurant is a bakery called 'The Loaf'. All breads used at the restaurant is baked fresh daily. Most people come for quick breakfast or to grab fresh bread in the evening time.
